meanings.definition: The quality or state of being murky.
meanings.sent1: The murkiness of the water made it difficult to see the fish swimming below.
meanings.sent2: The murkiness of the situation left everyone confused and unsure of what to do.
meanings.sent3: Despite the murkiness of the glass, she still managed to find her reflection and make a funny face.
meanings.sent4: The murkiness of his intentions was like a fog that obscured his true motives.
meanings.sent5: The deep murkiness of the cave made it feel like entering a mysterious underworld.

meanings.sent1: The murkiness of the contract made it hard to understand the terms and conditions.
meanings.sent2: The murkiness of the situation made it challenging to figure out who was telling the truth.
meanings.sent3: The murkiness of the excuse he gave was so obvious that it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The murkiness of her words was like a veil hiding the true meaning behind her message.
meanings.sent5: The murkiness of the lake water made it impossible to see what lay beneath the surface.
